cves.description: DNN (formerly DotNetNuke) is an open-source web content management platform (CMS) in the Microsoft ecosystem. Starting in version 9.0.0 and prior to versions 9.13.10 and 10.2.0, extensions could write richtext in log notes which can include scripts that would run in the PersonaBar when displayed. Versions 9.13.10 and 10.2.0 contain a fix for the issue.
problemType: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

cves.description: DNN (formerly DotNetNuke) is an open-source web content management platform (CMS) in the Microsoft ecosystem. Prior to versions 9.13.10 and 10.2.0, a module could install with richtext in its description field which could contain scripts that will run for user in the Persona Bar. Versions 9.13.10 and 10.2.0 contain a fix for the issue.
problemType: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')

cves.description: DNN (formerly DotNetNuke) is an open-source web content management platform (CMS) in the Microsoft ecosystem. Starting in version 9.0.0 and prior to versions 9.13.10 and 10.2.0, a content editor could inject scripts in module headers/footers that would run for other users. Versions 9.13.10 and 10.2.0 contain a fix for the issue.
problemType: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
